subject: Communication
title: The Dunning-Kruger Effect: Confidence vs. Competence
description: A quick win: understand The Dunning-Kruger Effect: Confidence vs. Competence.

hook.text: The least competent people are often the most confident. The most competent doubt themselves.

buildup.text: The effect: beginners overestimate their skill because they lack the knowledge to recognize their own incompetence.

discovery.text: As expertise grows, confidence dips â€” experts see how much they don't know. Then it rises again with mastery.

twist.text: The effect applies to arguments too. People with shallow knowledge argue most forcefully. Depth brings nuance.

climax.text: Recognizing Dunning-Kruger in yourself is the cure. True expertise includes knowing the limits of what you know.

punchline.text: If you're sure you know everything, that's when you know the least.

quiz.question: What happens to confidence as expertise grows?
options: It dips then rises again with mastery
